meanings.definition: The most common isotope of hydrogen, having one proton and no neutrons.
meanings.sent1: Protium is the simplest form of hydrogen.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study protium to understand the basic structure of atoms.
meanings.sent3: The protium atom walked into a bar and ordered a glass of water.
meanings.sent4: In the vast universe, protium shines like a lone star in the night sky.
meanings.sent5: Children learn about protium in their science class as the building block of matter.

meanings.definition: The lightest and most abundant isotope of hydrogen.
meanings.sent1: Protium is found in most water molecules on Earth.
meanings.sent2: Many stars in the galaxy contain protium in their cores.
meanings.sent3: The protium atom was so light, it floated effortlessly in the air.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was as light and carefree as a protium atom dancing in the breeze.
meanings.sent5: The protium isotope is like the foundation stone of the hydrogen family, supporting all its relatives.
